summary: This is an email exchange between US Attorney's Office personnel and a contractor regarding securing non-responsive documents in the 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database. The email discusses locking off access to 397,365 non-responsive documents while keeping 1,218,719 responsive documents accessible for the case.

events.title: Request to lock non-responsive documents
events.description: A request was made to lock off access to 397,365 non-responsive documents in the 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database, leaving only 1,218,719 responsive documents accessible.

events.title: Follow-up confirmation request
events.description: A follow-up email requests confirmation about securing non-responsive data and confirms folder structure for search warrant returns.

keyFacts: The 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' Relativity database contained 1,218,719 documents tagged as 'Identified Responsive' for use in the case.
There were 397,365 documents in the same database that were NOT tagged as responsive and needed to be locked off from access.
The email exchange shows procedural steps to secure non-responsive materials while maintaining access to responsive documents for the legal team.
